meanings.definition: To cast (concrete, etc.) in a reusable mold before transporting to the final site.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers precast the concrete panels for the new building.
meanings.sent2: The company precasts the walls for quick assembly at the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The idea of precasting the entire house in sections sounded like a time-saving plan.
meanings.sent4: She precasts her daily routine in her mind, ensuring a smooth day ahead.
meanings.sent5: The artist precasts the sculpture to perfection before unveiling it to the public.

meanings.definition: Concrete or other material that has been cast in a reusable mold before being transported to the final site.
meanings.sent1: The precasts were delivered to the construction site for immediate installation.
meanings.sent2: The precasts of the bridge segments were carefully inspected before assembly.
meanings.sent3: The children built a mini city using precasts made of play dough.
meanings.sent4: The precasts of the ancient columns were like pieces of history waiting to be placed.
meanings.sent5: The precasts of the garden statues added a touch of elegance to the landscape.
